subject: Merry Christmas
header: We wish all the readers of the newsletter, Merry Christmas. I hope and wish you all enjoying quality time with your loved ones.
Belated happy birthday to my favourite language, Perl, on completing 34 years. Mark Gardner used his weekly blogging schedule to celebrate the occassion in his blog.
Do you remember which year you first picked the Perl language?

For me, I was introduced to Perl in the year 1998. So technically, I am 23 Perl years old. How about you? I am wondering if anyone other than the creator, picked the language in the first year itself. If you know the name then please do share with us. I am sure there must be handfull that I am not aware of.

Talking about birthday celebration, I would like to wish belated Happy Birthday to the mother of chief editor, Gabor Szabo. As per the record, my birthday was last Monday i.e. 20th December. Till date, I never celebrated my birthday, this year also went without celebration.

I noticed that I am getting close to my 100th edition of the newsletter. This is my 94th edition. It would be a big achievement for me, personally, to reach the number. I am looking forward to the 556th edition of the weekly newsletter as that would be my 100th edition.
Stay safe and enjoy the holiday break.

entries.text: Come to the Perl and Raku Conference in Houston! You can expect to see a lot of presentations on Perl, Raku, and supporting languages.

entries.title: PDL 2.063_01 released
entries.author: ed_jordan
entries.text: Summary: 64-bit indexing, native complex number support, automatic pthreading using all available CPU cores, faster installation thanks to parallel-building, memory-mapped data, repository hosted on GitHub, easy to use "with" Inline.

chapters.title: The Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Anwar will help you step out of your comfort-zone. You can even win prize money of $50 Amazon voucher by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one winner at the end of the month from among all of the contributors during the month. The monthly prize is kindly sponsored by Peter Sergeant of PerlCareers.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Dot Product" and "Palindromic Tree". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 145

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Semiprime" and "Ulam Sequence" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial
chapters.header: A section for newbies and for people who need some refreshing of their Perl knowledge. If you have questions or suggestions about the articles, let me know and I'll try to make the necessary changes. The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.
